title: Sable grape jellies
instructions: Soak the gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes. Put the juices, wine, and sugar in a pan. Bring to a gentle simmer; stir to dissolve the sugar. Take off the heat.
Squeeze the water from the gelatine and add to the liquid. Stir until completely dissolved.

Line the bottom of 6 mini jelly moulds (about 150ml) with the grapes, cut side up, and put the remaining grapes on top. Transfer the jelly liquid to a jug and pour a little over the grapes to just cover them; chill for 1-2 hours until almost set; keep the remaining liquid at room temperature.
Pour the remaining liquid over the jellies; chill overnight.
Dip the moulds in hot water to release the jellies; turn out onto small plates to serve.
imageDesc: Two fancy saucers with dark red jellies in the middle, garnished with scattered sable grapes.
